atomic_tests.name: ESXi - Terminates VMs using pkill
atomic_tests.description:
In VMWARE ESXi, process names starting with vmx are associated with running VMs. An adversary can use the pkill command to kill all processes with a prefix vmx.
[Reference](https://www.crowdstrike.com/blog/hypervisor-jackpotting-ecrime-actors-increase-targeting-of-esxi-servers/)

vm_host.description: Specify the host name of the ESXi Server

vm_user.description: Specify the privilege user account on ESXi Server

vm_pass.description: Specify the privilege user password on ESXi Server

atomic_tests.name: ESXi - Avoslocker enumerates VMs and forcefully kills VMs
atomic_tests.description:
Avoslocker malware has inbuilt functionality to enumerate the VM instances and uses the esxcli command to forcefully power off them.
[Reference](https://blogs.vmware.com/security/2022/02/avoslocker-modern-linux-ransomware-threats.html)

vm_host.description: Specify the host name of the ESXi Server

vm_user.description: Specify the privilege user account on ESXi Server

vm_pass.description: Specify the privilege user password on ESXi Server

atomic_tests.name: ESXi - vim-cmd Used to Power Off VMs
atomic_tests.description:
Adversaries may power off VMs to facilitate the deployment of ransomware payloads.
[Reference](https://lolesxi-project.github.io/LOLESXi/lolesxi/Binaries/vim-cmd/#power%20off%20vm)

executor.name: command_prompt
executor.command: echo "" | "#{plink_file}" -batch "#{vm_host}" -ssh -l #{vm_user} -pw "#{vm_pass}" "for i in `vim-cmd vmsvc/getallvms | awk 'NR>1 {print $1}'`; do vim-cmd vmsvc/power.off $i & done"

vm_host.description: Specify the host name or IP of the ESXi server.

vm_user.description: Specify the privilege user account on the ESXi server.

atomic_tests.name: Abuse of Linux Magic System Request Key for Reboot
atomic_tests.description: adversaries with root or sufficient privileges to silently manipulate or destabilize a system. By writing to /proc/sysrq-trigger, they can forced to reboot.
